messages.body: First Horizon National: Cramer's Top Takeaways $AAPL http://dlvr.it/QQFdZD

links.title: First Horizon National: Cramer's Top Takeaways
links.description: Did you miss "Mad Money" on CNBC? If so, here are some of Jim Cramer's top takeaways. In an "Executive Decision" segment, Cramer sat down with Bryan Jordan, chairman, president and CEO of First Horizon National ( FHN) , the Tennessee-based regional bank that just posted a three-cents-a-share earnings beat with net interest margins up 52 basis points.

messages.body: Waste Management: Cramer's Top Takeaways $AAPL http://dlvr.it/QQFdXW

links.title: Waste Management: Cramer's Top Takeaways
links.description: Did you miss "Mad Money" on CNBC? If so, here are some of Jim Cramer's top takeaways. For his "Executive Decision" segment, Cramer spoke with Jim Fish, president and CEO of Waste Management ( WM) , which just posted an eight-cents-a-share earnings beat, but saw shares decline as investors worry over the impact of trade wars with China on the company's recycling business.

links.title: Not Thankful For Fridays: Cramer's 'Mad Money' Recap
links.description: Next week is chock full of earnings news, Jim Cramer told his viewers Friday. Let's just hope that unlike today, those earnings actually matter. Cramer said his game plan starts on Monday with earnings from Kimberly-Clark ( KMB) .

messages.body: Jim Cramer: It's Hard to Buy on Fridays $AAPL http://dlvr.it/QQFMPl

links.title: Jim Cramer: It's Hard to Buy on Fridays
links.description: Jim Cramer: It's Hard to Buy on Fridays Have to admit, I would be itching to buy something if it weren't for the Friday blues, the incredibly heavy way the stock market trades ahead of worries about the next level of Chinese tension.

messages.body: Jim Cramer: Apple Isn't the Be-All and End-All of the Markets $AAPL http://dlvr.it/QQFMPX

links.title: Jim Cramer: Apple Isn't the Be-All and End-All of the Markets
links.description: Jim Cramer: Apple Isn't the Be-All and End-All of the Markets Yeah, Apple (AAPL) . What can you do? This is a market that is vulnerable to Apple and its suppliers. It is vulnerable to a potential boycott in China because the PRC knows that Apple is an American icon and even though Apple manufactures in China, this trade war is different.
